Submodules

sspike.beer module

Back-end event reader.

Make plots and tables of pnut outputs.

sspike.beer.bar(tabs)

TODO: Bar graph comparing event rates.

sspike.beer.draw(events_path, channels, save=False, test=False)

Plot event rates.

Parameters

  • events_path (str) – Location of dataframe csv.

  • channels (list of str) – Interaction channels to plot.

Note

Proton neutral rates cannot be combined with other rates yet.

sspike.beer.pay(tabs)

TODO: Print astrophysical yields. (Show rates from tabs.)

sspike.beer.tab(snowball)

Count binned event rates and create a table.

Parameters

snowball (Snowball) –

Returns

tab – File path to results.

Return type

str

sspike.pnut module

Process neutrino underground telemetry.

Functions to load SN models from and process event rates.

sspike.pnut.basic_events(snowball, target)

Estimate ibd and electron scatter events for cross-checking.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • target (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – File path to processed dataframe.

Return type

str

sspike.pnut.dxs_nc(E, T_p, a=1)

Neutral-current double differential cross-section.

Parameters

  • E (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • T_p (float) – Proton recoil energy in GeV.

Returns

dsig – Differential cross-section in with respect to proton recoil energy with units of cm^2 / GeV.

Return type

float

sspike.pnut.e_scat(snowball, target)

Electron-neutrino scattering events.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • target (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – Pandas dataframe with electron events by flavor.

Return type

dataframe

sspike.pnut.elastic_events(snowball, target)

Proton-neutrino elastic scattering events.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • target (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – Pandas dataframe with neutral-current events by flavor.

Return type

dataframe

sspike.pnut.ibd_events(snowball, target)

Inverse beta decay events.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • target (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspiked – Pandas dataframe with electron events by flavor.

Return type

dataframe

sspike.pnut.quench(T_p)

Convert proton recoil energy to electron equivalent energy.

Parameters

T_p (np.array) – Proton recoil energies of interest $[MeV]$.

Returns

  • E (np.array) – Electron equivalent energy in KamLAND.

  • Note – Quenching factors using WebPlotDigitizer on Fig. 6 in: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0168900210017018

sspike.pnut.snowglobes_events(snowball, target)

Process fluences with SNOwGLoBES via snewpy.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • target (str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

snowflakes – File path to processed dataframe.

Return type

list of str

sspike.pnut.sspike_events(snowball, target)

Process event rates using sspike functions.

Parameters

  • snowball (Snowball) – Simulation details.

  • target (list of str) – Name of SNOwGLoBES detector.

Returns

sspikes – File paths to processed dataframe.

Return type

list(str)

sspike.snowball module

Class for model details and data storage.

class sspike.snowball.Snowball(model, progenitor, transform, distance)

Bases: object

Simulation parameters and directory information.

Parameters

  • model (str) – Name of supernova model type from snewpy.

  • progenitor (dict) – Model specific simulation parameters.

  • transform (str) – Name of transformation type for snewpy to apply.

  • distance (float) – Distance to supernova in kpc.

models_dir

Local snewpy models directory.

Type

str

snowglobes_dir

Local SNOwGLoBES directory.

Type

str

sim_path

Simulation file containing initial neutrino fluxes.

Type

str

snowball_dir

sspike directory for simulation fluences and processed dataframes.

Type

str

sn_name

Name indicating model type and progenitor parameters.

Type

str

tarball

File path to tarball created by snewpy.

Type

str

fluence_dir

Directory path to extracted snewpy tarball.

Type

str

fluences()

Read fluence file and return dataframe.

sspike.sspike module

Command-line entry-point for sspike.

param model

Name of supernova model type or file path simulation specifications.

type model

str

param detector

Target/detector for simulations. Default kamland.

type detector

str, optional

param distance

Distance to supernova in kpc. Default 5.0

type distance

float, optional

param transform

Type of transformation to apply. Default NoTransformation.

type transform

str, optional

param mass

Progenitor mass in solar masses. Required for several models.

type mass

float or str, optional

param metal

Progenitor metallicity. Required for Nakazato_2013.

type metal

float, optional

param revival_time

Shock revival time. Required for Nakazato_2013.

type revival_time

str or int, optional

param omega

Rotation of progenitor. Required for Kuroda_2020.

type omega

str, optional

param b_field

Magnetic field strength of progenitor. Required for Kuroda_2020.

type b_field

str or int, optional

param eos

Nuclear equation of state. Required for Sukhbold_2015.

type eos

str, optional

param stir

Progenitor stirring parameter. Required for Warren_2020.

type stir

str or float, optional

Note

Supernova model and detector must be included in snewpy and SNOwGLoBES.

sspike.sspike.main()
sspike.sspike.run_sim(model, progenitor, transform, distance, detector)

Process simulation file with SNoGLoBES and sspike.

Parameters

  • model (str) – Model name from snewpy.

  • progenitor (dict) – Model specific parameters for simulation file.

  • transform (str) – Type of snewpy transformation to apply.

  • distance (float) – Distance to supernova.

  • detector (str) – Name of detector in SNOwGLoBEs.

sspike.targets module

Detector specifications.

class sspike.targets.Target(target)

Bases: object

Target/detector specific information.

Parameters

name (str) – Detector name in SNOwGLoBES (and sspike (copying SNOwGLoBES ( ;) ))).

N_p

Number of target protons.

Type

float

N_e

Number of target electrons.

Type

float

snow_channels

Channels used in SNOwGLoBES simulations.

Type

list of str

basic_channels

Channels for cross-checking sspike with SNOwGLoBES.

Type

list of str

nc_channels

Neutrino-proton neutral-current interaction channels by flavor.

Type

list of str
